Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery chalice-cup; interior: glazed black; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Such sherds have been identified as kantharoi by some scholars and as chalice cups by others. The horizontal handle usually found suggests that these are chalice cups. According to Schlotzhauer such pieces have not been excavated at Miletus, though locally made chalices have been found.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.737) (phase 3)
